title: Jesus Vallejo reveals Real Madrid encouraged him to join Wolves ahead of rival bidders
text:
Wolves defender Jesus Vallejo has revealed his parent club Real Madrid encouraged him to move to Molineux ahead of other interested teams from across Europe.

Vallejo joined Wolves on a season-long loan deal this summer after finding himself surplus to requirements at the Bernabeu following the arrival of Eder Militao.

The centre-back was pursued by a host of other clubs but eventually chose Wolves on the advice of Madrid and following phone calls with two of the club's players.

Jesus Vallejo says he joined Wolves on loan on the advice of parent club Real Madrid

Vallejo has made five appearances for Wolves since joining the club on a season-long loan deal

'I had offers this summer, both loans and permanent moves,' he told Diario AS.

'But I wanted to make this move and experience this club and the Premier League.

'I spoke with Jonny Castro and Adama Traore (both ex La Liga) before I came.

'I also spoke with Real Madrid, and the club encouraged me to come to Wolves, as I would continue to develop as a player.

Vallejo says he listened to advice from Wolves winger Adama Traore before joining the club

'Wolves played a role in the move, and I was excited by the project.

'Nuno called me and explained what my role would be, and it was Wolves wanted me more than other clubs.

Vallejo came through Real Zaragoza's academy before joining Madrid in 2015, though he has struggled to make an impact at the Bernabeu.

The 22-year-old spent the 2015-16 season on loan at Zaragoza, before joining Eintracht Frankfurt on a season-long loan deal the following season.
description: Wolves defender Jesus Vallejo has revealed his parent club Real Madrid encouraged him to move to Molineux ahead of other interested teams from across Europe this summer.
